args:
The party is blown away by the furious flames
of Leonidas's pactbound dragon. Afterward,
Alex tells the group about how she came to
live the life of an assassin. Unable to leave her
to a terrible fate, the party decides to help.
You're even more a fool than I thought\nto have followed me here.
We're here to knock ya on yer ass, pal,\nso get ready for pain! Hyaaaaargh!
I'll not permit you to attack His Excellency!\nFlash of Ruin! Hnnngh!
All that we do, we do to return life\nto the way it was on that day!
Engage them, men! Leave none alive!
You know, I've had better days than this...\nBut oh well! Hyaaaargh!
Form up, everyone! Meet them head-on!
Pathetic! You're no better than a swarm\nof feckless insects.
It is time to end this folly.\n...Mars! Come forth!
Uh oh. I think the Blazewyrm is about to\nlay the hurt on everyoneâ€”INCLUDING\nall of his allies.
But that's nothing I can't stop!
Are you so confident, girl? Hrrrrraaaaah!
Wait a second. That's not Mars,\nbut this mana DOES belong to him.\nAnd that means...
No! Mars! Did you actually let yourself\nbe taken over by a HUMAN?!
Such a disgraceful way to describe it.
When I formed my pact with Mars,\nI fulfilled his wish.

By channeling massive amounts of mana
through these ensorcellers, I have fulfilled
his desire to become the most powerful
dragon in the world!
A dragon is not a toy to be used in\nyour foul alchemical experiments!
The whole of human wisdom has been\npoured into this new creation of mine.\nNow...taste his blaze!

Commence charging of the Mana Calibur!
Use the magic amplifier to exceed the
critical temperature of dragon fire and
unleash a chain reaction!
Heh. See, Alex? It was just as I said.\nThat place was not where you were to die.

I prepared an appropriate final moment
for you. You did a fine job of luring the
enemy here.
In honor of your sacrifice, I swear to\nprotect your precious Church.\nHa ha! Aaaaah ha ha ha ha ha!
Is everyone all right? Can you move?
Ngh... I...think Mym saved us somehow.
I was able to weaken his flames just a bit.\nOh, but I'm still so sorry, darling.
If only I'd been able to take them\nall on myself!
How can that jerk still be alive?!
I don't think she's a threat at the moment.\n...Are you all right, Alex?
I won't leave a wounded person to die.
Here, come on. Put your arm around me...
Are you always so friendly with\nwomen who attempt to kill you?
No, this is sort of a first.
Cleo? Can you tend to her wounds?
And while she does that, Alex, why don't\nyou tell us what the deal is between\nyou and Elisanne?
This seems personal between you two.\nDid something happen in the past?
No. I'll tell him. It's the least I can do\nafter you saved my life.
I was orphaned at a young age.
My life was a succession of back alleys\nand near-death experiences...until the\nday that Elisanne rescued me.
She brought me to the Ilian Church.
To me, it seemed like paradise.
While I was at the Church, I came to\nunderstand things like love and kindness,\nand so I made a promise to myself...
I swore I would do anything to protect\nthe Church, and I swore to make sure\nno children ever had to suffer as I did.
Because people appeared who attempted\nto destroy my paradise from within.
Morsayati is Ilia's child. This is clear.\nAnd yet, people appeared who began\nto doubt this truth.
You're talking about the Scrolls of\nPerdition, yes?

I am. The bishop decreed that we must
love Morsayati as well as Ilia, so why do
people refuse to acknowledge this fact?
Why do they seek to sunder the Church?

I decided I would bring judgment upon
those who would defile paradise, using
the skills I honed during my days living
on the streets.
I would punish those who will not repent\ntheir sins, and accept those who admitted\ntheir mistakes.
In so doing, the Church would again be\nmade one. And then Elisanne could\ncome back...
That is why I will not accept a defector,\nnor any who would support her.
I have said enough. I must return\nto His Excellency Leonidas.
You would return and kneel before the\nman who very nearly took your life?!
To live and have no home to return to\nis its own kind of death.
If I become a sacrifice, I at least ensure\nthat the children who come after me will\nnever again be lost.
I guess she's got her own reasons for\nfighting. ...Even if they ARE bonkers.
But if she continues to heel at Leonidas's\ncommand, she will become his victim.
I understand, Elly. We'll find a way to\nmake her realize the error of her ways.
